intro: Baeckea diosmifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baeckea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and are borne on short pedicels. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
